alert.note: Alert for Union (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 6:49PM MDT until April 18 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Brookings and Moody Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Union, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Akron. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, several farm levees are overtopped with significant flooding of agricultural lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Sunday was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 13.5 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Big Sioux River Akron 16.0 16.1 Sun 7 pm 15.8 15.5 15.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
